title.narrative: EARLY CHILDHOOD DEVELOPMENT (RKLA 3)

description.narrative: By end of 2015, all municipalities provide an essential set of diversified Early Child Development (ECD) services, which contributes to Early Learning, Equitable Access To Quality Education, Learning Outcomes. UNICEF aims to achieve this through Systems Strengthening And Institution Building. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: By end of 2015, as a result of social sector reforms, the Government add resses targeted disparities in the quality of and access to basic social services for vulnerable children and families

sector.narrative: Capacity development of ECD frontline workers
Provision of (formal and non-formal) early-learning / pre-primary education (including in temporary learning spaces)
System strengthening - early learning / pre-primary policy, leadership, and budget
System strengthening - early learning / pre-primary standards and governance
System strengthening - inclusive education for children with disabilities

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: By end of 2015, all municipalities provide an essential set of diversified ECD services
% of kindergartens providing outreach services in the most disadvantaged communities, in line with ELDS
An essential set of diversified ECD services exists, based on an improved normative framework and funding formula that favours disadvantaged municipalities

baseline.value: The Child Protection Law provides for the organization and management of kindergartens but does not cover the provision of any other type of ECD (formal or informal) services. Funding is currently only available for the 40 municipalities with existing kindergarten facilities
